summary.p:
This manuscript is the fifth in a collection of five smṛti texts. In the marginal header at the beginning, as well as on the title page of the bundle, the text is titled Viṣṇusmṛti. However, there seem to be two different texts here:
folios 1r-3v correspond to the text of the Ātreyasmṛti (Goverment Oriental Library, Mysore, 1656/2) or to the end of the Vṛddhātrisaṃhitā (Government Oriental Library, Mysore, A 136/7 etc.),
folios 4r-8v correspond to the text of the southern recension of the Yamasmṛti, chapter 2 (ed. Neuß 2011).
There is, however, at least one manuscript titled Viṣṇusmṛti which transmits the text of the Ātreyasmṛti with 40 additional verses (Goverment Oriental Library, Mysore, 3154/1), but they do not seem be the same verses as seen here.
